item.title: Veleda add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "One final paragraph of advice: do not burn yourselves out. Be as I am - a reluctant enthusiast....a part-time crusader, a half-hearted fanatic. Save the other half of yourselves and your lives for pleasure and adventure. It is not enough to fight for the land; it is even more important to enjoy it. While you can. While it’s still here. So get out there and hunt and fish and mess around with your friends, ramble out yonder and explore the forests, climb the mountains, bag the peaks, run the rivers, breathe deep of that yet sweet and lucid air, sit quietly for a while and contemplate the precious stillness, the lovely, mysterious, and awesome space. Enjoy yourselves, keep your brain in your head and your head firmly attached to the body, the body active and alive, and I promise you this much; I promise you this one sweet victory over our enemies, over those desk-bound men and women with their hearts in a safe deposit box, and their eyes hypnotized by desk calculators. I promise you this; You will outlive the bastards." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Veleda add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Veleda add a quote by Allie Brosh
item.description: "The absurdity of working so hard to continue doing something you don’t like can be overwhelming." -- Allie Brosh

item.title: Veleda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Nothing so needs reforming as other people's habits. Fanatics will never learn that, though it be written in letters of gold across the sky. It is the prohibition that makes anything precious" -- Mark Twain
